com.yantra.api.ydm

Interface changeShipment

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YDMApi, YIFApi

    public interface changeShipment

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document changeShipment(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The changeShipment API changes Shipment and related attributes.

    • Method Detail

      • changeShipment

        org.w3c.dom.Document changeShipment(YFSEnvironment env,
                                    org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                             throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                    java.rmi.RemoteException

        The changeShipment API changes Shipment and related attributes. The changeShipment API can be used to:

        • Modify values of attributes such as ShipmentCarrier, Weight, Volume
        • Add an OrderLine or complete a Release to Shipment
        • Remove or backorder a line or quantity from a Shipment
        • Delete a Shipment
        • Create, modify and delete Containers
        • Create, modify and delete ShipmentCharges
        • Create, modify and delete AdditionalDates
        • Create, modify or delete instructions at the Shipment , ShipmentLine or Container level
        • Replace Shipment with new Lines, Containers and Charges

        For shipments which require shipmenet level integration, this API does not allow follwing modifications once manifestation has started:
        • Unpacking or canceling any package in the Shipment.
        • Overpacking any unmanifested package in the Shipment.

        The changeShipment API and the related APIs createShipment and confirmShipment are similar to entity APIs like createRole and modifyOrganization, which are used to modify the underlying entities in the database. Only the attributes that are to be modified should be passed. Passing an attribute with blank values is not the same as not passing the attribute. When an attribute is passed with a blank value, the changeShipment API blanks out the value of the corresponding column in the database. If the attribute is not passed, no change is made in the database. If the PromisedApptStartDate and PromisedApptStartDate is changed by the api, then it is assumed that capacity is available for the modified appointment and no check is made for capacity again.

        The changeShipment API performs one of the following two transactions based on the Action attribute of the input. This Transaction ID is used to raise the ON_SUCCESS event:

        • If Action is Create, then the TransactionId is CREATE_SHIPMENT.
        • Otherwise the TransactionId is CHANGE_SHIPMENT.

        In addition, the following transactions are implicitly called on the order pipeline to update the order status:

        • If a quantity is added to the shipment, then the transaction executed on the order pipeline is INCLUDE_SHIPMENT.
        • If a quantity is removed from the shipment, then the transaction executed on the order pipeline is REMOVE_SHIPMENT.

        • In the scenerio where the Carrier sends the load updates with the Load Shipment details before the shipment updates arrive, manageLoad API creates a Load Shipment record without the complete shipment details.
        • If the shipment corresponding to the Load Shipment record is created, the Load Shipment record is updated with the Shipment information.
        • This Creation of Load Shipment records while creating load without the prescence of the shipment is available only if the rule Creation Of Load Without Shipment Allowed is enabled in the configuration.

        Tag information is stored only if the Node tracks tag information in inventory or the Buyer mandates tag information. Shipment lines with tagged items should have,

        • Actual tag details has to be given to confirm the shipment.
        • If the item is serialized, serial no. should be passed for each quantity.

        Requested Tag information for Shipment lines with tagged items will be defaulted as follows,
        • If the shipment is created for an order release, requested tag information will be defaulted from the orderline/ schedule requested tag attributes if the order has requested tag information.
        • If the shipment is created with shipment lines specified, requested tag information will be defaulted from the orderline requested tag attributes if not passed in the input.
        • If correct requested tag information is not provided, shipment creation will fail in the case if over shipment is not allowed.

        In case of Outbound Shipments:
        • If Resource Planning is enabled for the ShipNode, planned tasks are created upon creation of shipments. This is done to determine the effort required by various resource pools to complete different activities like pick, pack and ship, inside the warehouse. Whenever Shipment is changed, the planned tasks are recomputed, by evaluating the conditions again. If shipment is getting canceled or deleted, all the planned tasks created for the shipment will be deleted.
        • Shipment group is re-determined based on the attributes getting modified and the shipment is then updated this shipment group.


        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        If Action is Create, the following user exit is called before performing any operations on the input XML passed to this API:
        com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMBeforeCreateShipment.
        If Action is Modify, the following user exit is called before performing any operations on the input XML passed to this API:
        com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMBeforeChangeShipment.
        The following user exit is called for shipment weight computation:
        com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMGetOverridenAttributesForShipmentLineItemUE
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetTagNoUE
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetItemSubstitutesOverrideUE
        com.yantra.wms.japi.ue.WMSOverrideShipmentGroupUE

        Events Raised:

        Events raised during transaction CREATE_SHIPMENT

          ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE:
            This event is raised when an order release status is changed for the order in shipment. This event is cofigured for transaction ORDER_CHANGE
            Data published - YFS_ORDER_CHANGE.ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE.xml
            Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt
            Template Support:
            Yes
          ON_SUCCESS:
            Data Published - YDM_CREATE_SHIPMENT.ON_SUCCESS.html, YDM_CREATE_SHIPMENT.ON_SUCCESS_dtd.txt
            Key data - shipment_dbd.txt

        Events raised during transaction CHANGE_SHIPMENT

          ON_SUCCESS:
            This event is raised upon successful execution of the API.
            Data Published YDM_CHANGE_SHIPMENT.ON_SUCCESS.html, YDM_CHANGE_SHIPMENT.ON_SUCCESS_dtd.txt
            Key data - shipment_dbd.txt

          ON_LINE_QTY_REDUCTION:
            This event is raised when quantity is reduced on any shipment line. The event is not raised when the shipment is cancelled.
            Data Published YDM_CHANGE_SHIPMENT.ON_LINE_QTY_REDUCTION.html, YDM_CHANGE_SHIPMENT.ON_LINE_QTY_REDUCTION_dtd.txt
            Key data - shipment_dbd.txt

          ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE:
            This event is raised when an order release status is changed for the order in shipment. This event is cofigured for transaction ORDER_CHANGE
            Data published - YFS_ORDER_CHANGE.ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE.xml
            Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt
            Template Support:
            Yes

        Events raised during transaction REMOVE_SHIPMENT

          ON_CANCEL:
            This event is raised when the changeShipment API is called with the CancelRemovedQuantity flag set to Y, and quantity is canceled off the original order as a result.
              Data Published - YFS_REMOVE_SHIPMENT.ON_CANCEL.html, YFS_REMOVE_SHIPMENT.ON_CANCEL_dtd.txt
              Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt

            Template Support: Yes

          ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE:
            This event is raised when an order release status is changed for the order in shipment. This event is cofigured for transaction ORDER_CHANGE
            Data published - YFS_ORDER_CHANGE.ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE.xml
            Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt
            Template Support:
            Yes

        Events raised during transaction CANCEL_TO_SHIPMENT

          ON_SUCCESS:
            This event is raised upon successful execution of the API.
            Data Published YDM_CANCEL_TO_SHIPMENT.ON_SUCCESS.html, YDM_CANCEL_TO_SHIPMENT.ON_SUCCESS_dtd.txt
            Key data - shipment_dbd.txt

        Events raised during transaction CAPACITY_CHANGE

          ON_STD_CAPACITY_FREED:
            Raised when consumption is freed and standard capacity becomes available for the day.
            Data Published: INV_CAPACITY_CHANGE.ON_STD_CAPACITY_FREED.html
            Template Support: Yes
            Configuration Required for backward compatibility: No
          EXTERNAL_CAPACITY_CHANGE:
            This event is raised when capacity consumptions are changed.
            Data published: YFS_CAPACITY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_CAPACITY_CHANGE.xml
            Template Support: Yes
            Configuration Required for backward compatibility: No

        Raised under the transaction INVENTORY_CHANGE

          INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_DEMAND_CHANGE:
            Raised when there is a demand update.
            Key Data: INVENTORY_CHANGE_EXTERNAL_DEMAND_CHANGE_dbd.txt
            Data Published: INV_INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_DEMAND_CHANGE.html
            Template Support: Yes
          INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_SUPPLY_CHANGE:
            Raised when there is a supply update.
            Key Data: INVENTORY_CHANGE_EXTERNAL_SUPPLY_CHANGE_dbd.txt
            Data Published: INV_INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_SUPPLY_CHANGE.html
            Template Support: Yes

        Audits:
        YFS_SHIPMENT_STATUS_AUDIT record is written if a Shipment is created. No audit is written for modification of existing Shipment.

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes


Parameters:
env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

Returns:
An XML document that contains all the information about the Shipment. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

Throws:
com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes. in the standard error files.
java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
